context: The other source for bicarbonate may be the cap system of the landfill which consists of a two-foot thick layer of lime rock, a commonly found natural material in Florida. The lime rock consists of primarily calcium carbonate and it is the consolidated form of limestone. The rain water slowly dissolves the limestone cap and creating voids within the limestone cover by the following reactions (www.swfwmd.state.fl.us/hydrology/sinkholes/brochure.pdf): CaCO 3 + 2 H 2 O → Ca ( OH ) 2 + H 2 CO 3 H 2 CO 3 → H + + HCO 3 - Fig. 4d presents the ammonia levels in leachate from April 2001 to April 2006. Although the time series projections indicate a decreasing trend, field data showed a steady trend for ammonia levels. Ammonia data did not show the typical seasonal trend in 2003 and 2004. These irregularities may be due to changes in sample handling.
